name: Wangchhu River Basin Flood Forecasting Model
TRMM-based Flood Detection System
comments: https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007%2Fs11069-008-9324-5

name: NASA Sea level portal
comments: Longterm global sea level (Altimeters)  New York City Panel on Climate Change 2019 Report Chapter 3: Sea Level Rise    https://doi.org/10.1111/nyas.14006  ??

name: NASA Sea level portal
comments: Longterm, global  and large scale hydrology (GRACE and GRACE-FO)

name: NOAA NWS Weather Prediction Center Quantitative Precipitation Forecast (QPF)
comments: These "Quantitative Precipitation Forecasts" were indicated by one of the fire managers as critical to assessing flooding risks.  A variant = "Quantitative Precipitation Estimates" (not sure about exact relationship).

name: G-REALM
comments: derived from satellite altimetry

name: GRRATS
comments: derived from satellite altimetry
derived from MODIS

name: SSEBop Actual Evapotranspiration Attributed to 12-digit Hydrologic Unit Code Watersheds
comments: estimate evapotranspiration between storms

name: Hydro-Web/Theia
comments: Derived heights from satellite altimeters provided as a time series with multiple file formats by LEGOS/CTOH and CNES

name: NASA Giovanni
comments: Listed are 5 datasets from TRMM. There are more datasets that provide precipitation data in Giovanni

name: Hydroshare/CUAHSI
comments: NSF funded project to distribute and visulize hydrology data

name: DAHITI
comments: derived from satellite altimetry, offers API

name: NOAA Coastal Flood Exposure Mapper
comments: NOAA High-tide flooding threshholds; no DOI provided but there is a doc giving links to the datasets used in this application at: https://coast.noaa.gov/data/digitalcoast/pdf/flood-exposure-data.pdf

name: NOAA Coastal Flood Exposure Mapper
comments: FEMA flood zone maps; no DOI provided but there is a doc giving links to the datasets used in this application at: https://coast.noaa.gov/data/digitalcoast/pdf/flood-exposure-data.pdf

name: NOAA Coastal Flood Exposure Mapper
comments: National Hurrican Center storm surge flooding scenarios derived from Sea, Lake, and  Overland Surges from Hurricanes (SLOSH) model, paper about dataset at: http://dx.doi.org/10.1175/WCAS–D–14–00049.1

name: NOAA Coastal Flood Exposure Mapper
comments: Sea level rise inundation scenarios derived from data created for the Sea Level Rise and Coastal Flooding Impacts Viewer -- this one links to another NOAA Digital Coast application for this dataset

name: NOAA "What's Your Water Level?"
comments: The public can submit reports on their local water level at https://noaa.maps.arcgis.com/apps/GeoForm/index.html?appid=3b55f51105d64d5895f252374e7c902a and the data are aggregated on this application. Kinda cool but doesn't seem to have gotten much exposure yet (5 reports submitted in the past month)

name: USGS Flood Alert System
publication: DOI For the entire waterdata.usgs set http://dx.doi.org/10.5066/F7P55KJN Further metadata links are no good
comments: wondering about potential for setting alerts for real time at a system of gages

name: Daily US Snowfall and Depth
comments: Data repository

name: CERA Coastal Emergency Risks Assessment
comments: ADCIRC Model Storm Surge Guidance for Emergency Managers and Decision Makers. CERA is based upon work supported by Louisiana Sea Grant at LSU and the U.S. Department of Homeland Security under Grant Award Number DHS-14-ST-061-COE-001A.

Soil Moisture Monitoring and Prediction
over U.S.A

NASA SMAP L4 Global 3-hourly 9 km EASE-Grid Surface and Root Zone Soil Moisture Geophysical Data, Version 4
